column4: does the universe component also contain non-free software? the homepage does not clearly state this
I dont think so, but let me check.
I think it's in restricted, but try this:

I'm not using ubuntu. There are licence policies for main and restricted on the homepage, but not for universe. the homepage says: "The universe component is a snapshot of the free, open-source, and Linux world.". what does that mean?
means it's covered by GNU Lic.
See here for more info on GNU open-source Lic: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.html
so it means it contains free and only free software?
I know the definition of free software
I just found the sentence unclear
well non-free doesn't mean it costs you anything.
I try to rationalise it similar to restricted drivers, there free, but non open to open-source development.
But agreed, it is kind of confusing.
they are not free in terms of free software foundation
yes, that's what way I understand it.

I mean there's no explanation for what "free" and "open-source" means for the universe component. and "linux world" could also include non-free software. there's a detailed licence policy for main and restricted, but not for universe
I suspect there's legal begal stuff in all that, I just dont have the "legal begal" answers :-)
